entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 24 at 3:01PM AKDT until August 25 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 4 PM AKDT THURSDAY FROM KIPNUK TO THE MOUTH OF THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER... * LOCATION...The southern Kuskokwim Delta Coastline, from Kipnuk to the mouth of the Kuskokwim River * WAVES AND SURF...Storm surge will generally be 4 to 6 feet above the normal highest tide line. Offshore waves in the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RISING WATER LEVELS ON SMALL STREAMS AND CREEKS DRAINING THE BROOKS RANGE... A series of fronts will impact the region, bringing copious amounts of widespread rain that will cause water levels to rise on small streams and creeks draining the south slopes of the Western Brooks Range.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... Strong south winds to 25 to 45 mph will develop along the West Coast late tonight and will bring elevated surf to parts of Norton Sound and the Yukon Delta on Thursday, with elevated surf persisting into Friday before winds diminish. Wave action will combine with storm surge and be the greatest
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by elevated river levels will continue into the weekend. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 24 at 6:36AM PDT until August 24 at 7:15PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A slow moving low pressure system will support afternoon thunderstorms. The storms will be stationary to slow moving, allowing for heavy rain amounts over small areas causing flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING...

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 24 at 6:36AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A slow moving low pressure system will support afternoon thunderstorms. The storms will be stationary to slow moving, allowing for heavy rain amounts over small areas causing flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING...

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 24 at 3:13AM CDT until August 24 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 7:14PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Natrona County through 800 PM MDT... At 713 PM MDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm over Bar Nunn, or near Casper, moving southeast at 15 mph. This storm has a history of producing nickel size hail. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations
